재밌음

The game is TRASH, would avoid purchasing. 

The matchmaking is NEVER right, in fact, the "matchmaking" is pathetically bad. 

Killers rendering the game nearly unplayable with camping and tunnelling, while the developers do nothing. For example, borrowed time should last until you exit a chase and the terror radius of the killer so the killer can keep hitting you but it doesn't do anything so they're forced to go chase somebody else. A killer that sits near the hook should stop the hook progression, similar to being in a chase when you need to mend. This would stop camping and tunnelling completely and render the game playable.

Many of the killers are OP, where they can single hit down you and then all they do is tunnel / camp you out.

Mori should be changed to only be available after the 2nd hook.

They are constantly releasing improvements and DLC showing a strong and continued investment into the game which is nearly 4.5 years old, except there's more and more performance issues each time they try to "improve" the game. They're even running a survey at the time of review about performance issues, showing they know they exist but the questions were worded in a way to avoid actually finding any issues. The times when the biggest performance hits occur, such as being hit by a killer, did not appear in the questions but "moving around the map", "when in a chase", "vaulting over a pallet" were the times they asked about performance when they know there is no issue during these times.

I wouldn't recommend this game because it will become very stale, boring and repetitive. Same maps, same killers using the same meta of perks, doing the same generators, etc.

If you do survivor, you are basically forced to do SWF (Survive with friends) or you will get stuck with people who disconnect after being hit or kill themselves on the hook at first hook.

The "cash grab" DLC's that only unbalance the game more that are never properly tested or thought out. 

Overall a very SHIT GAME that gets worse every new DLC/chapter. The only downside is that there's really nothing else that's been successful enough to come along in a similar space.

A still broken matchmaking system, and heavily toxic community. That's all you should need to hear.
This game will only really be enjoyable in custom games with friends. The devs won't do anything to properly fix either of the things mentioned in the first sentence. Only flimsy adhesive bandages.

Would not recommend, unless you have friends, or are willing to sweat in ranked.

I personally urge to not play ranked matches if you want to have fun. It will only result in disappointment.

Edit:
Insta-kill items called a Mori are also a deterring factor to playing, as it allows a Killer to instantly eliminate Survivors from the game after a single hook.

また、ロードアウトを編成することによって、逆転を狙ったり、能力をアップグレードしたりして違った楽しみ方でプレイ出来ます。

The game is fun in beginning, you'll be owned by a killer but as you learn to play just like any other game you'll be better, the game is harsh for being a killer you'll eventually realize this as you start playing as a killer that the game is highly survivor sided, if there is a strong killer or perk it's mostly nerfed by the devs. some good perks are hidden behind a DLC paywall, either you purchase them or you grind and get them with in-game currency. 

in conclusion the game keeps you in a loop it just gives you enough to keep playing it but it'll affect you for real you'll find it less enjoyable and more stressing.

Also, another easier and effective wayh to make friends as the killer is once you hook someone, stand in front of them and proceed to smack them while they're on the hook until they're dead. Oh and Moris. We love moris! 

However, if you wanna make friends as survivors, pallet stunning and then butt dancing right after is ALWAYS a good way. Also gen rushing! Killers love gen rushing!

I have roughly 1000+ hours across multiple consoles of playtime and this is my honest opinion:

This game used to be fantastic but incompetent devs are ruining the experience. They refuse to listen to the community and continue to release bandaid patches that result in even more bugs. The last few killer releases have been unfinished and unplayable but they still have the audacity to charge full price, see the twins and the most recent update where several new perks have been disabled while they are being 'fixed'. These issues should not be making it into the live game. What is the point of the PTB if they don't bother to patch the issues before full release?

On top of that, the 'better' ranking system continues to fail and match low ranked players with high ranked ones and constant server issues mean you can't even play.

The only improvements that have been made are related to either tiny aspects of the game of the visual aspects. The graphical updates have been an improvement but they should not be a priority when the game itself can barely function. The changing of stage 2 hook from button mashing to skill checks is also an improvement as well as the updated HUD which shows what hook survivors are on but I'd rather be able to play the game than have these features.

The community itself is also pretty toxic which is unsurprising but the toxicity could drastically be reduced if these issues were addressed and exploits were patched as they lead to more frustration.

Overall: If you are looking for an on again off again game, DBD is suitable but I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who wants to play in high ranks or highly competitively as the issues will really harm your experience.

Super fun game to play both killer and survivor, depending on whether or not you have friends.
Not without its bugs, and sometimes laggy interactions. The devs don't always make the smartest balance decisions, so quality of life for survivors or killers can suddenly change with an update. 
Both sides have interesting skills to learn and master, and most roles offer rewards for skill expression. Not quite competitive, not quite casual. Lots of good twitch and youtubers to give a taste of what high skill play looks like. Check them out if you're considering the purchase.

BE WARNED:
Some meta perks (available for all characters) are locked behind DLC and are very tedious to get F2P.  This doesn't bother me, as I want to support the game, but you should factor this into the overall price.

As a die-hard horror junkie and Halloween aficionado, it is in my opinion that this is the best game to ever hit the horror genre. It's every horror fan's dream. I won't explain the game, because you most likely have already done the research yourself. Now, all you need to do is decide which side you will lend your services to.. 

My advice, choose whether you want to play Killer or Victim errr... Survivor. In all reality you can choose to level up both factions, but you may find it more rewarding to unlock all of the teachable perks and prestige your characters from a specific faction. 

This game takes some grinding and planning if you want to play amongst the best, but that's not a bad deal for a game this entertaining. It gets a 9/10 from me ;)

-OGKB
